content.explanation:
Every function is a relation, but not every relation is a function. Think of it this way:

🔗 RELATION: Any connection between inputs and outputs
⚙️ FUNCTION: A special relation where each input connects to exactly ONE output

It's like the difference between a messy friend and a reliable friend. A messy friend might give you different answers to the same question, but a reliable friend is consistent.
content.example:
📱 Contact list examples:
• Your phone number → Your name (FUNCTION - one number, one person)
• Your birthday → People born that day (RELATION - one date, many people)
• A person → Their parents (RELATION - one person, two parents)
content.key_point: Functions are reliable relations - same input always gives the same output.

interactive.question: Which relationship represents a function?
options: A student → Their favorite subjects (could have multiple)
A car's VIN number → The car's make and model
A movie → Its actors (multiple actors per movie)
